alert.note: Alert for Lewis (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 07 at 1:48AM PST until January 08 at 11:01AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Newaukum River Near Chehalis affecting Lewis County. .Heavy rain over the Cascades as well as the Southwest Interior lowlands pushed the Newaukum River near Chehalis to major flood levels early Friday morning. The river is cresting early Friday morning and will start to recede this afternoon. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Newaukum River Near Chehalis. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 205.5 feet, flood waters will inundate most roads and a majority of residential and commercial areas within the region. Swift flood waters will become deep and hazardous, especially near river channels. A stage of 205.5 feet on the Newaukum corresponds to Phase 4 in the Lewis County flood system. Flooding will occur all along the river including headwaters, forks, tributaries, and other streams within and near the Newaukum River Basin. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:45 AM PST Friday the stage was 205.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:45 AM PST Friday was 205.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is cresting near 205.6 feet at 1 AM Friday. The river will remain fairly steady for the remainder of the morning then begin receding this afternoon. The river will not fall back below flood stage until Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 202.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 205.5 feet on 02/08/1996. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 1245 PM PST.
